szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.intrfc.arena.game.playerManager

Interface PlayerManagerPrivileged

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GameUpdater, PlayerManagerBasic, PlayerManagerUpdatable, ResettableGameClass
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlayerManager

    public interface PlayerManagerPrivileged
extends PlayerManagerUpdatable, GameUpdater
    An extension to the PlayerManagerUpdatable interface that is exposed to the core backend classes managing the game logic as well as any classes external to the game logic.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Throwable getCrashReason(PlayerToken token)
      Gets the reason why a player has crashed during the game level, if he/she has crashed, otherwise it returns null.
      OnScoreEventCallback getScoreChangeCallback()
      Gets a callback object to use when setting player scores after some events.
      java.util.Map<PlayerToken,PlayerInfo> getUnregisteredPlayers()
      Gets a set of players identified by their tokens, that have failed in the current game level.

      • Methods inherited from interface szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.intrfc.arena.game.playerManager.PlayerManagerUpdatable

        getPipesUpdatable, getPlayerTokenMap

      • Methods inherited from interface szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.intrfc.arena.game.playerManager.PlayerManagerBasic

    • Method Detail

      • getScoreChangeCallback

        OnScoreEventCallback getScoreChangeCallback()
        Gets a callback object to use when setting player scores after some events.
        Returns:
        a callback for manipulating player scores.

      • getUnregisteredPlayers

        java.util.Map<PlayerToken,PlayerInfo> getUnregisteredPlayers()
        Gets a set of players identified by their tokens, that have failed in the current game level. This could be due to throwing an exception or having had their pipes destroyed.
        Returns:
        the set of failed players during the current game level identified by their tokens.

      • getCrashReason

        java.lang.Throwable getCrashReason(PlayerToken token)
        Gets the reason why a player has crashed during the game level, if he/she has crashed, otherwise it returns null.
        Parameters:
        token - the token identifying the player
        Returns:
        the reason the player crashed (the exception that was thrown)
